At least 17 people died: the 2 suicide bombers, 8 soldiers, 1 police officer, and 6 civilians. At least 74 others, including soldiers, police officers and civilians, were also wounded. The military blamed the attack on the Abu Sayyaf, though the Islamic State East Asia Province - which has ties to some Abu Sayyaf factions - also claimed responsibility. The military was also investigating claims that local police with ties to the Abu Sayyaf might have been involved in the bombing, and that the bombing might be related to the 29 June killing of 4 military intelligence officers by Jolo police officers. The 4 intelligence officers killed on 29 June were reportedly on the trail of the 2 suicide bombers who carried out this latest bombing.

On 26 August 2020, a drug suspect was killed during a police raid in Barangay Dalawinon (Magsaysay, Davao del Sur, Davao Region). Police said they recovered shabu (crystal meth) from the slain suspect.

On 26 August 2020, a drug suspect was killed during a police raid in Barangay Apas, Cebu City (Cebu, Central Visayas). Police said they were trying to serve the suspect an arrest warrant when they were fired upon.
On 26 August 2020, a drug suspect was killed during a police raid in Barangay Cansuje (Argao, Cebu, Central Visayas). Police said they recovered shabu (crystal meth) from the slain suspect.

On 26 August 2020, a police officer was killed while another was wounded in an attack by unidentified assailants in Barangay Ragayan (not found) (Marantao, Lanao del Sur, Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao). The motive for the attack was unclear.

assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Philippine Drug Enforcement Agency
notes: On 26 August 2020, 3 drug suspects were killed during a raid by a joint police and PDEA team in Barangay Abar 2nd, San Jose (Nueva Ecija, Central Luzon). Authorities said they recovered shabu (crystal meth) from the slain suspects.

source: Sunstar (Philippines); Panay News; Philippine News Agency
notes: On 27 August 2020, a drug suspect was killed while 7 were arrested during a police raid in Barangay Pahanocoy, Bacolod (Negros Occidental, Western Visayas). Police said they recovered shabu (crystal meth) from the suspects.

source: Philippine Information Agency; Panay News; Sunstar (Philippines); Philippine News Agency
notes: On 27 August 2020, a government soldier was wounded while four NPA militants were arrested following a five-minute firefight between the NPA and the military in Barangay Carabalan, Himamaylan (Negros Occidental, Western Visayas). The military also said they retrieved weapons from the rebels.

Around 27 August 2020, 2 drug suspects were shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified assailants, with the bodies found in Barangay Atipuluan, Bago (Negros Occidental, Western Visayas). The exact time and place of the killings are unknown. The bodies were found on 27 August, next to a note saying 'Di pagparisi drug pusher ko ya' ('Don't be like me, I am a drug pusher').

On 27 August 2020, a drug suspect was wounded and arrested during a police raid in Barangay San Vicente, Baguio (Benguet, Cordillera Administrative Region). Police said they retrieved shabu (crystal meth) from the suspect, who they reported to be a high-value target.

assoc_actor_2: Manobo Ethnic Group (Philippines); Military Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Citizen Armed Force Geographical Unit
notes: On 28 August 2020, 2 members of the Manobo tribe - one a military Citizen Armed Force Geographical Unit (CAFGU) auxiliary - were shot dead by suspected NPA militants in Barangay Bayogo (Madrid, Surigao del Sur, Caraga). Authorities said that the CAFGU auxiliary was off-duty at the time of the attack. Authorities also said that the other civilian might have been suspected of being a military informer.

On 28 August 2020, a government soldier was wounded during a 40-minute firefight between the NPA and the military in Barangay Aglobong (Janiuay, Iloilo, Western Visayas). The military said that an undetermined number of NPA militants were also wounded. The military also said that it retrieved weapons from the rebels.

On 29 August 2020, 8 farmers were killed in an attack by an unidentified clan militia in Barangay Poblacion (Kabacan, Cotabato, Soccsksargen). A 9th victim later died due to injuries. Police suspect that the attack was part of a rido (clan blood feud) between two hostile clans. Police said that the victims seem to have been summarily executed, correcting earlier reports that there was a shootout.

On 29 August 2020, 2 suspected Abu Sayyaf militants and 1 government soldier were killed during a firefight between the Abu Sayyaf and the military in Barangay Kabbon Takas (Patikul, Sulu, Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao).

On 30 August 2020, a drug suspect was shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified assailants in Barangay 2, Bacolod (Negros Occidental, Western Visayas). Police said that the slain suspect had previously surrendered for involvement in illegal drugs.

On 30 August 2020, the NPA and the military engaged in a 20-minute firefight in Barangay Poblacion District II (Silago, Southern Leyte, Eastern Visayas). There were no reported casualties on both sides.

assoc_actor_2: Drug Suspects (Philippines); Police Forces of the Philippines (2016-)
notes: On 31 August 2020, a drug suspect (also an active police officer) was left unhurt in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified assailants in Barangay Marigondon, Lapu-Lapu (Cebu, Central Visayas). Two civilian bystanders were wounded. The drug suspect-cum-police officer was not in his place of assignment at the Cordillera Administrative Region and is assumed off-duty. Police said that the police officer was suspected of involvement in illegal drugs and was reportedly on a police drug watchlist.

On 31 August 2020, 3 Aeta tribesmen were reportedly detained and tortured by the military in San Marcelino (Zambales, Central Luzon). The tribesmen, who were actively opposing mining activities in the area and who were suspected by the military to be NPA rebels, were allegedly assaulted by soldiers and forced to eat human waste. The military denied the accusations of torture. NPA and military clashes had been happening in the area in recent days, leading to the displacement of Aeta tribes.

assoc_actor_1: SPARK: Samahan ng Progresibong Kabataan; Students (Philippines)
notes: On 31 August 2020, a few members of student group SPARK staged a demonstration in front of the Commission on Higher Education headquarters in Quezon City (Metro Manila, National Capital Region), to demand that the government declare an academic freeze and the suspension of all classes until January 2021. SPARK claimed that the education system was not ready for the shift to online classes amid the COVID-19 pandemic. [size=a few]

assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Criminal Investigation and Detection Group
notes: On 31 August 2020, a police officer attached to the Criminal Investigation and Detection Group was shot dead by unidentified assailants in Barangay Burgos (Rodriguez, Rizal, Calabarzon). The police officer was shot at his residence and is assumed off-duty. The motive for the attack was unclear.

assoc_actor_1: Bayan Muna; Defend Jobs Philippines; Journalists (Philippines); Labour Group (Philippines)
notes: On 31 August 2020, on the occasion of National Heroes' Day, employees of broadcaster ABS CBN and supportive groups such as Bayan Muna and Defend Jobs Philippines staged a demonstration in front of the ABS CBN compound in Quezon City (Metro Manila, National Capital Region), in order to condemn Congress's denial of ABS CBN's franchise renewal. [size=no report]

On 31 August 2020, an alleged NPA official was killed during a shootout with a joint police and military team in Barangay Dancalan (Ilog, Negros Occidental, Western Visayas). The joint police and military team were reportedly attempting to serve the alleged NPA official a warrant of arrest in connection with the killing of four police officers on 18 July 2019. The authorities also said that they recovered weapons and other items from the alleged rebel.

On 31 August 2020, on the occasion of National Heroes' Day, demonstrators led by BAYAN Central Visayas staged a demonstration in front of the Department of Agriculture office in Mandaue (Cebu, Central Visayas). The demonstrators criticized the government's handling of the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic and demanded more support for 'modern-day heroes' like health workers. Police dispersed the demonstrators after 10 minutes. [size=no report]

On 31 August 2020, on the occasion of National Heroes' Day, demonstrators staged a demonstration at the Bantayog ng mga Bayani in Quezon City (Metro Manila, National Capital Region). The demonstrators criticized the government's handling of the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic, demanded more support for 'modern-day heroes' like health workers, and condemned the recent killings of activists. [size=no report]
